Articles.Content:
What is your favorite rocket fuel engine?

By Stock and DLC

These are the nicknames of the engines (look them up on the wiki for their pictures)

I started using the Thud right away in my career and am still using it for landers.  It just works.

The Wolfhound has been pushing craft all over the Kerbol system and is still being used out to Laythe.  Again, it just works.
Wolfhound all the way for me.

Terrier and Cheetah for me, I’ve landed on and returned from every body in the Kerbol system using either or both of them, they’re small enough to use on 1.25m rockets and provide the best balance of efficiency, weight and cost; the Wolfhound might be more efficient and more powerful but the excess weight means it’s only really a better choice for very large and heavy payloads whereas the Terrier and Cheetah work on everything from Baby’s First Kerbin Orbiter to crewed Eve and Tylo landers.

I love using the Nerv and the Wolfhound; I've done a lot of cool things with their high ISP!

3 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Baby’s First Kerbin Orbiter

Thank you for coining that term
I've always been partial to the Kodiak. I only wish it was made more clear that it lacked gimbal and that it was meant to be used with the Cub.
Thud, all the way. 100%. Absolutely always useful.
To those advocating the Thud… Why? Aside from the gimbal range, it’s terrible.

Because it just plain works.  It is there from the start of a career and is still useful later on, at least for me.

Early on.

On Laythe too.
